definition: to empathize with/to show solicitude for/T-shirt (loanword)
to emphasize down to last detail (idiom); to show every possible consideration/meticulous care

sentences.english: The hardship of body and mind of man of A phoenix show solicitude for, more help him prostitute of outer call together.
sentences.chinese: 阿鳳體恤丈夫身心的辛苦，更幫助他在外召妓。

sentences.english: And behold WuShanShan understand and sympathize with local guide to support his side in m.
sentences.chinese: 不料吳珊珊瞭解並體恤地陪在徐峯身邊給他支持。

sentences.english: One of the best resumes we've seen, made on a T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: 這是我們見過的最具創意的簡歷之一，體恤衫。

sentences.english: For girls, we have T-shirts in red for only 18yuan.
sentences.chinese: 對女孩來說，我們有紅色體恤衫僅18元。

sentences.english: He puts on his new white T-shirt and yellow cap.
sentences.chinese: 他穿上自己新的白色的體恤衫和黃色的帽子。

sentences.english: I’ve got a green and white football shirt.
sentences.chinese: 我有一件綠色和白色混和的足球體恤。

sentences.english: He puts on his new white T-shirt and yellow cap.
sentences.chinese: 他穿上本身新的白色的體恤衫和黃色的帽子。

sentences.english: Cohen is wearing a Math-Club T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: Cohen穿了件數學俱樂部的體恤衫。

sentences.english: He often likes to wear black T-shirt and blue pants.
sentences.chinese: 他經常喜歡穿黑色的體恤和藍色的褲子。

sentences.english: So are fuzzy slippers or your favorite old T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: 那些毛絨拖鞋或最喜歡的老體恤衫也一樣。

sentences.english: She is wearing a striped T-shirt , blue jeans and purple shoes .
sentences.chinese: 她穿一件條紋體恤，藍色牛仔褲和紫色的鞋子。

sentences.english: Let me try that T-shirt on.
When you look deep within your own heart true compassion arises of its own accord.
sentences.chinese: 當你深入你自己的心真正體恤時，自行其事。

sentences.english: She is wearing a T-shirt today.
sentences.chinese: 她今天穿着一件紅體恤衫。

definition: care/solicitude/to show care for/concerned about/attentive to
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to show concern and care for
disadvantaged social groups (e.g. the handicapped)/the economically and politically marginalized/the dispossessed
to empathize/to allow (for sth)/to show understanding/to appreciate
to set an example (idiom); to serve as a model
to be deeply concerned/to be troubled (by)
